questions.question: What does it mean for a sentence to be a tautology?
questions.answer: Every possible interpretation makes the sentence true.

questions.question:
Answer all of the following:
  1. A sentence is contingent iff it is falsifiable and consistent
  2. A sentence P is a contradiction if it is not a tautology.
  3. If a sentence is consistent, then it is falsifiable.
Construct a truth-table to show that C\ \&\ (B\vee A)\approx (C\ \&\ B)\vee(C\ \&\ A)
Write an explanation for why if p,q\models r, then the sentence (p\ \&\ q)\to r is a tautology.
Provide a natural deduction proof to demonstrate C\to(B\vee A),\ \sim B\ \&\ \sim D,\ A\leftrightarrow B,\ ((E\vee B)\leftrightarrow C)\to(A\vee D)\vdash E
What is the definition of subset?
questions.answer: A\subseteq B\leftrightarrow \forall x(x\in A\to x\in B)

questions.question: True or false: The power set of the empty set is the empty set. If true, explain why. If false, calculate the actual power set.
What does it mean for a relation to be symmetric? Also, provide an example of a symmetric relation.

Prove that if A
eq\emptyset, then either A\setminus B
eq\emptyset or A\cap B
eq \emptyset.
Prove that if B and C are disjoint and A\cap C is nonempty, then A\not\subseteq B.
What does it mean (by definition) to say 3\mid n?
questions.answer: There is a natural number k such that 3k=n.

questions.question: Prove that for any natural number n, n(n^2 - 1) is divisible by 3.
Must a valid argument have premises that are true in the real world? Why?
What does it mean for a logical system to be sound? Using the syntax and grammar of truth-functional logic,
